content.title: Financial Assistance For Education Of Children Of Registered Worker (HBOCWWB)
content.department: Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance for Education of Children of Registered Worker (HBOCWWB)' was launched to provide annual financial assistance of ₹8,000/- to ₹20,000/- to the children of registered workers from Class I to Diploma, Graduation, and Post-Graduation. Additionally, a one-time incentive of ₹21,000/- to ₹51,000/- will be given to children with outstanding performance in Class 10th examinations.
benefits: ₹8,000/- per annum for Elementary Education (1st to 8th grade)
₹10,000/- per annum for Secondary Education (9th to 12th Class)/ITI Course
₹15,000/- per annum for Higher education (first year to final year of bachelor's degree)
₹20,000/- per annum for Postgraduate (from first year to final year of Master's degree)
One-time incentive based on Class 10th examination performance ranging from ₹21,000/- to ₹51,000/-
All educational expenditure for study in engineering, medical, technical education, management, and other professional courses will be borne by the Board
Hostel expenditure up to a maximum of ₹1,20,000/- will be borne by the Board
eligibility: The worker should be registered under Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB)
The registered worker should have a minimum of one-year regular membership
Children of registered workers studying in Class-I to Postgraduate are eligible to apply
Students must be studying in any institution/school/college of Haryana state
Self-employed or employed students are not eligible for benefits
exclusions: Financial assistance will not be given again for the same class in case of failure
Students who are self-employed or employed will not be eligible for benefits

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To provide annual financial assistance of ₹8,000/- to ₹20,000/- to the children of registered workers from Class I to Diploma, Degree, Graduation, and post-graduation.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Children of registered workers studying in Class I to Postgraduate.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for residents of Haryana State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident/domicile of Haryana State.

faqs.question: How many children of a construction worker can benefit from the scheme?
faqs.answer: This benefit is payable up to three female and two male children only.
